title: Docker on Ubuntu
description: A step-by-step guide to installing Docker on Ubuntu.

steps.description: This command updates the list of available packages and their versions.
This command downloads the package information from all configured sources.

steps.text: Install packages to allow apt to use a repository over HTTPS.
steps.description: These packages are required to use a repository over HTTPS.

steps.command: sudo apt install ca-certificates curl gnupg lsb-release
steps.description: This command installs the required packages.
This adds Docker’s official GPG key to ensure the authenticity of the Docker packages.
This command creates a directory for the key and adds the GPG key.

steps.text: Set up the Docker APT repository.
steps.description: This command adds the Docker repository to your system’s software sources.

steps.command:
echo 
  "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg] https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu 
  $(lsb_release -cs) stable" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list > /dev/null
steps.description: This command adds the Docker repository.

steps.text: Update the package index again with the Docker repository.
steps.description: This command updates the package index with the newly added Docker repository.
This command downloads the package information from all configured sources.

steps.text: Install Docker Engine, containerd, and Docker Compose.
steps.description: This command installs the latest version of Docker Engine and its components.

steps.command: sudo apt install docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io docker-compose-plugin
